result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas S Porter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Per Rotation Order, incoming branch 2 judge, Josann Reynolds, shall be assigned all open cases previously assigned to former branch 2 judge, Maryann Sumi.
Final pre-trial on November 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Def appeared for drug screening.  Full COMPAS evaluation scheduled for 10-16 @ 5:00

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:51
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jon O. Helland.  Lanny B. Glinberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Willie C.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 2

Defendant appeared.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
